n = int(input())
s = input()

count = 0

for i in range(n - 2):
    if s[i] == "A" and s[i + 1] == "B" and s[i + 2] == "C":
        count += 1
print(count)
import sys

N = int(sys.stdin.readline())
S = sys.stdin.readline().rstrip()

print(S.count("ABC"))

#!/usr/bin/env python3

import sys, re

N = int(input())
S = input()

print(len(re.findall("ABC", S)))
